--- "Bradley, Todd" <todd.bradley@p...> wrote:
> [...] I'd like to do something like Rainsberger's JUnit
> recipe 4.6 "Separate the different kinds of test suites"***.
> But for some reason I can't verbalize I don't like the
> approach of classifying tests using a tag interface.
> 
> Instead, since I'm using Java 5, I'd prefer to use annotations.
> Does anyone have an example TestFilter implementation that
> uses annotations instead of tag interfaces?  Or is there
> some other tool I should be looking into?

In "JUnit Classic"  (v3.8  ;-)  I typically make long running tests 
extend a class of my chosing, so that I can turn on and off all tests 
in child classes using a configuration file of some sort.

IE: PersonTest extends DatabaseTestCase extends TestCase
